metadata.synopsis: Interactive dialogue with both Commander and mother. Mother asks players to look for her kid while the commander is obviously confused and doesn't want to investigate the case for some reason
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to either commander or mother with both of them available for dialogue, 160.29; 51.441; -15.193

12.speaker: Lora
12.text: My daughter's name is Vanra. We were in the Blushing Mermaid when she went missing.
12.context: NodeContext: confused, trying to reign in her temper (just about holding on)

43.speaker: Lora
43.text: How many times do I need to say it? You sent word about a lead - said that I should come see you about it.
43.context: NodeContext: confused, trying to reign in her temper (just about holding on)

5.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
5.text: Of course, Madam, let me just... forgive me, why are you here?
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: slight wince, like a small stab of painNodeContext: slight wince on ellipsises, as if she's in pain (she's been hexed by a hag and it's fucking with her memory)

95.speaker: Lora
95.text: Is this some kind of sick joke? Do you have any idea what I've been through these past few days?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You're Lora, right? And your child is missing?
33.context: NodeContext: To player - relieved and desperate

84.speaker: Lora
84.context: NodeContext: To player - relieved and desperate

22.speaker: Lora
22.text: My daughter Vanra, my little girl, she's missing!

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Calm down - let the poor Flaming Fist alone.

11.speaker: Lora
11.text: You try staying calm when your kid is missing!

72.speaker: Lora
72.text: This stupid, useless Fist said she had a lead, but she must have been sucking dream mist or something.
72.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, frustrated, feeling helpless (flaming fist is just in front of her)

34.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
34.text: Madam, tell me... you said... she was... ah... taken from a tavern?
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: wincing, like she's in pain, hand to headNodeContext: struggling to get the words out - the memory is there but she just can't reach it

94.speaker: Player
94.text: *You catch the barest tendrils of magic coiled around the Flaming Fist.*
94.context: NodeContext: nearly shouting - pissed off, frustrated

4.text: *You catch the barest tendrils of magic coiled around the Flaming Fist.*
4.context: NodeContext: nearly shouting - pissed off, frustrated

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *You catch the barest tendrils of magic coiled around the Flaming Fist.*
55.context: NodeContext: nearly shouting - pissed off, frustrated

77.speaker: Lora
77.text: Yes. The Blushing. Mermaid. Down by the docks. I've told you a hundred times - why aren't you listening?
77.context: NodeContext: nearly shouting - pissed off, frustrated

0.speaker: Player
0.text: A hag took her - I saw it with my own eyes.

40.speaker: Lora
40.text: A hag has her? Gods above.

42.speaker: Lora
42.text: What does a hag want with Vanra? My poor child...

74.speaker: Lora
74.text: You have to do something - you have to save her. I have no one else. Please, help my little girl. Please.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: If you can pay me, I'll help you.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Did you say your daughter's name is Vanra? I'm afraid she's dead.
16.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

68.speaker: Lora
68.text: Is this some kind of bit you and the Fist are running? 'Cause it's not bloody funny. Vanra is lost - and these louts won't help me find her!

46.speaker: Player
46.text: She was eaten by a hag.

76.speaker: Lora
76.text: What? You're serious? Vanra is... Vanra...

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I'm sorry, I did what I could to save her.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Believe me or don't - your kid is still dead.

83.speaker: Player
83.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Someone, or something, has tampered with her memory.*
26.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Someone, or something, has tampered with her memory.*

48.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

9.speaker: Narrator
9.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

86.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
86.text: What, ah, what were we discussing?
86.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

85.speaker: Player
85.text: She's a typical Fist - they never listen.
85.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

41.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
41.text: I am listening... now if you'll both calm down, this lady can tell me why she's here.
41.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

69.speaker: Player
69.text: It's not very responsible to take a kid to a tavern.
69.context: NodeContext: player has asked why she brought vanra to a tavern, defnesive, trying to change the subject (she got drunk when vanra was nabbed)

44.speaker: Lora
44.text: Don't you dare try to blame me. My daughter is gone!
44.context: NodeContext: player has asked why she brought vanra to a tavern, defnesive, trying to change the subject (she got drunk when vanra was nabbed)

24.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
24.text: Madam - do not raise your voice. Calm down, and tell me why you're here.
24.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

67.speaker: Lora
67.text: What is happening? I feel like I'm going mad.
67.context: NodeContext: upset, hands in hair/head. Lost, feel like everyone knows what's happening but you

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm afraid it's too late - Vanra is dead.
66.context: NodeContext: defensive - she tore the place apart (and pulled a knife on a blushing mermaid staff memember when they tried to boot her)

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Have you searched for your daughter?
82.context: NodeContext: defensive - she tore the place apart (and pulled a knife on a blushing mermaid staff memember when they tried to boot her)

29.speaker: Lora
29.text: Of course! I haven't stopped. I tore that tavern apart - the rooms, every nook and cranny I could think of. She's gone.
29.context: NodeContext: defensive - she tore the place apart (and pulled a knife on a blushing mermaid staff memember when they tried to boot her)

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Someone's tampered with the Flaming Fist's memory.
93.context: NodeContext: surprised, then the moment she tries to address the missing child, wincing and in pain again (the hag hex)

71.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
71.text: Nonsense. I'm fine. Madam, tell me why you're... urgh... here, and I will assist.
71.context: NodeContext: surprised, then the moment she tries to address the missing child, wincing and in pain again (the hag hex)

75.speaker: Lora
75.text: Gods, you're right. Something's wrong with her.

32.speaker: Lora
32.text: Can you help me? I've no family, and Vanra's father isn't around. The Flaming Fist were my last resort.
32.context: NodeContext: the most vulnerable we've seen her

59.speaker: Lora
59.text: I'm so afraid. And so tired. I've been looking night and day, everywhere I could.
59.context: NodeContext: the most vulnerable we've seen her

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I could help - for a price.
60.context: NodeContext: player has tried to walk away, and she desperately stops them

7.speaker: Lora
7.text: I've got a little something stashed away - from a long time ago. You'll be paid, you have my word. Just find my little girl - please.

3.speaker: Player
3.context: NodeContext: player has tried to walk away, and she desperately stops them

70.speaker: Lora
70.text: Wait! Please at least look out for her - she's called Vanra, she's seven years old and has red hair - like me.
70.context: NodeContext: player has tried to walk away, and she desperately stops them

23.speaker: Lora
23.text: If you see her, just let me know. Please. I'll be at home - I'll get no help here.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Someone has tampered with the Flaming Fist's memory - perhaps a hag?
38.context: NodeContext: has actually met the hag, but it's been removed from her memory. Professionallty outraged

62.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
62.text: A hag? Preposterous! No such creature would dare set foot in the city.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I think there's a hag in the city - this might be connected.
36.context: NodeContext: has actually met the hag, but it's been removed from her memory. Professionallty outraged

73.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
73.text: A hag in Baldur's Gate? Preposterous.
73.context: NodeContext: has actually met the hag, but it's been removed from her memory. Professionallty outraged

15.speaker: Lora
15.text: Don't scare me more than I already am. What would a hag want with my Vanra? She's just lost, that's all!
15.context: NodeContext: in very stiff denial, thinks the player is just trying to confuse her

80.speaker: Lora
80.text: Gods, I'm so afraid. And so tired. I've been looking night and day, everywhere I could.
80.context: NodeContext: the most vulnerable we've seen her

53.speaker: Lora
53.text: I've no family, and Vanra's father isn't around. The Flaming Fist were my last resort.
53.context: NodeContext: exhausted, feels like she's out of options

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'll help you find your daughter.
57.context: NodeContext: grateful (in her world, people don't help other people), exhausted, vulnerable

30.speaker: Lora
30.text: You will? Thank you - I haven't slept or eaten since she disappeared. I'm terrified something has happened to her.
30.context: NodeContext: grateful (in her world, people don't help other people), exhausted, vulnerable

6.speaker: Lora
6.text: Her name is Vanra. She's seven years old, and has red hair - like me. We were in the Blushing Mermaid when she was taken - just up by the docks.
6.context: NodeContext: little too quick on the denial

35.speaker: Player
35.context: NodeContext: little too quick on the denial

45.speaker: Lora
45.text: No. Unless you count a couple of old drinking mates at the next table - but they'd be no help. They barely remember their own names.
45.context: NodeContext: little too quick on the denial

28.speaker: Lora
28.text: I was sober though, I swear. I stop in the 'Maid for a drink sometimes - but it was only a quick one!

92.speaker: Player
92.text: You must have some witnesses, surely.
92.context: NodeContext: disgusted at the words 'flaming fools' - sick of their shit. Pleading at the end

20.speaker: Lora
20.text: Of course - the front of house, Bosun Gannet was there, and the owner of the Blushing Mermaid, Captain Grisly.

19.speaker: Lora
19.text: Neither lifted a finger to help me look - it was awful.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I'll head to the Blushing Mermaid now.
18.context: NodeContext: disgusted at the words 'flaming fools' - sick of their shit. Pleading at the end

91.speaker: Lora
91.text: Thank you. I'll head home - can't stand being around these idiots any longer. Come find me the moment you hear anything.
91.context: NodeContext: disgusted at the words 'flaming fools' - sick of their shit. Pleading at the end

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Forget the Fists - tell me everything you know.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'm listening - tell me what happened.

37.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
37.text: Excuse me, citizen, but if this is a criminal matter, it's my business. Not yours.

61.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
61.text: Now, madam, if you'll just tell me why you're here, I'll take down the details.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: No - and it's not my problem.

10.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
10.text: Indeed - kindly leave this to the Flaming Fist. We have it under control.
